poem:
"Brief Elegy for Veronica"

In Broxburn, a bird has stopped singing,
The embers of her song dwindling amid the mundane.
Named Veronica but hailed as Chitsidzo,
From Zimbabwe's golden hues to the grey of West Lothian.
A 7.55 watermark etches the final chorus,
Royal Infirmary silent, motherhood sobbing,
And in another cold court, a story gasping
For the breath of understanding.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Man appears in court charged with murder of West Lothian woman A 46-year-old man has appeared in court charged with murder after the death of a “much-loved’” mother in Broxburn, West Lothian. Kasikai Chinyanga was arrested in connection with the death of 42-year-old Chitsidzo (Veronica) Chinyanga, originally from Zimbabwe. Police were called to a disturbance at a property on Cunnighar Road, Broxburn, at about 7.55pm on Sunday, and Veronica was taken to the Royal Infirmary". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
